intro: Dressleriopsis, commonly known as the ghost orchid, is a rare and elusive flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is characterized by its unique, orchid-like appearance with elongated, pale green leaves and a single, delicate flower that often appears in the absence of leaves. The plant is epiphytic, meaning it grows on the surface of trees or other plants without deriving nutrients from them. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires specific conditions to bloom. Due to its rarity and habitat specificity, Dressleriopsis is considered a conservation concern.
